conclusion: Identify charges at vertices A, B, C, D and need to find electric field at center.
Recall electric field formula E = k * q / r² and principle of superposition.
Square with side length L, vertices A, B, C, D; AB horizontal, AD vertical.
Distance from each charge to center is r = L/√2.
Electric field due to charge +q at A is E_A = k * q / r², directed away from A.
Electric field due to charge +q at B is E_B = k * q / r², directed away from B.
Electric field due to charge -q at C is E_C = k * q / r², directed towards C.
Electric field due to charge -q at D is E_D = k * q / r², directed towards D.
Set up coordinate system with center at origin, x-axis horizontal, y-axis vertical.
Positions of charges: A (-L/2, L/2), B (L/2, L/2), C (L/2, -L/2), D (-L/2, -L/2).
E_A direction from A to center: (L/2, -L/2), magnitude 2*k*q / L².
E_B direction from B to center: (-L/2, -L/2), magnitude same as E_A.
E_C direction from C to center: (-L/2, L/2), magnitude same as E_A.
E_D direction from D to center: (L/2, L/2), magnitude same as E_A.
Re-evaluate directions: E_A from A to center (L/2, -L/2), E_B from B to center (-L/2, -L/2).
